settings.content:
Test

Paxton & Whitfield “we” are committed to protecting and respecting your privacy. This Privacy Notice explains in detail the types of personal data we may collect about you when you interact with us. It also explains how we’ll store and handle that data and keep it safe. We hope the following sections will answer any questions you have but if not, please do get in touch with us.

It’s likely that we’ll need to update this Privacy Notice from time to time so please come back and check it whenever you wish. By visiting www.paxtonandwhitfield.co.uk you are accepting and consenting to the practices described in this policy.

Paxton & Whitfield Ltd is the data controller.

BUTTON

settings.right_column_content: These cookies are used to enable Google Analytics functionality. They help us track and analyse anonymous visitor information such as which pages are popular, and how many people visit the website. This data helps us improve the website and your shopping experience.
This cookie stores information about our product categories, and aids in loading the category pages more quickly in your web browser.
We use these cookies to allow you to easily compare products on the website.
This cookie stores the currency you have chosen to view the products in.
These cookies store information relating to your customer account such as whether or not you are logged in, and which customer group you belong to.
These cookies indicate whether or not caching is enabled, which greatly helps the fast delivery of pages to the web browser.
This cookie stores the unique code we use to identify you on the website.

settings.title: British Wholesale Cheese for Export
settings.content:
Paxton & Whitfield is recognised around the world as a purveyor of the very best of British cheese and fine foods. We have been the Royal Cheesemongers since 1850 and our branded products are designed to tell this story.

We can work with your business to supply you the highest quality cheese, fine foods and cheese-related homewares which will bring a little slice of St James’s into your range!

Our wholesale team will train your staff – from around the world if necessary – so that they know the fascinating story of our company and have knowledge about the products they are selling.

settings.title: Wholesale cheese for hotels, restaurants and caterers
settings.content:
From our sites in London, Bath and the Cotswolds, we supply many of the finest hotels, restaurants, bakeries and cafes.

Our cheese list supports indie British cheesemakers; including several smaller artisan dairies and we also stock excellent examples of Continental favourites. We offer fast delivery and a personal service.

Whether you're a small independent business or part of a major group, we can be relied upon to bring you the very best quality British and Continental cheese in the quantities you require at a time that's convenient to you.

settings.quote_text: A gentleman buys his hats at Locks, his shoes at Lobbs, his shirts at Harvie and Hudson, his suits at Huntsman and his cheese at Paxton & Whitfield.

settings.content:
While the earlier years were good for Paxton & Whitfield, times were tougher from the 1860s. Smart society's appetite for traditional English farmhouse cheese was fading in favour of Continental cheese and, in England, factory style production was becoming the established practice. Many artisan cheeses totally disappeared as small farmers sent their milk to industrial creameries. This trend continued throughout the two World Wars and, in the 1940s, with eggs, butter and cheese in short supply 93 Jermyn Street became an ordinary grocery shop.

After World War II and a series of different owners, business improved as Paxtons rekindled their contacts with the traditional cheesemakers of rural Britain and started bringing in the best that Europe could offer. Two new Paxtons opened, in Stratford upon Avon and Bath not to mention their virtual shop on the web. Customers who value quality know they will always be able to find it at Paxtons. As Winston Churchill once observed "a gentleman buys his cheese at Paxton & Whitfield". In Paxton's third century of trading we hope you will allow us to help you enjoy the fascinating and diverse world of cheese too.

settings.question: What cheese can we have?
settings.answer: We stock over 150 Artisan cheeses in the shops so there is a wide range to suit all tastes. The harder cheeses form the base so they can support the rest of the cake, then a mixture of cheeses becoming gradually smaller make up the top of the cake. Please bear in mind that some cheeses are seasonal and they also have a different taste at different times of the year.

settings.question: What do we serve with the cake?
What do we present the cake on?
Where does the cake need to be stored?
How soon do I need to order the cake?
